name: Essential Eight Maturity Assessment
description:
Essential Eight Maturity Assessment is the foundation of Australian government cyber security posture. The ACSC's Essential Eight framework provides prioritised mitigation strategies against cyber threats.

Regular assessment against maturity levels (0-3) enables organisations to identify gaps and prioritise remediation efforts. Queensland Government mandates Maturity Level 2 for most agencies.

Integrate Essential Eight assessment into continuous compliance monitoring rather than point-in-time audits. Automated tooling can track configuration drift against baseline requirements.

name: Zero Trust Architecture
description:
Zero Trust Architecture operates on the principle of 'never trust, always verify'. This approach is increasingly mandated in government security frameworks, moving away from perimeter-based security models.

Key principles include micro-segmentation, least-privilege access, continuous verification, and assuming breach. The ISM's access control requirements align well with Zero Trust principles.

Implement Zero Trust incrementally - start with identity-centric controls, then expand to network segmentation and workload protection. Document alignment with ISM controls throughout.

name: Privacy Impact Assessments
description:
Privacy Impact Assessments (PIAs) are mandatory for Queensland Government projects handling personal information under the Information Privacy Act 2009. PIAs identify and mitigate privacy risks early in project lifecycles.

Integrate PIAs into project governance frameworks, conducting assessments during the design phase when changes are least costly. The Office of the Information Commissioner provides templates and guidance.

For high-risk processing, consider conducting Threshold Assessments first to determine if a full PIA is warranted.

name: Threat Modelling
description:
Threat Modelling systematically identifies potential security threats and vulnerabilities during system design. Frameworks like STRIDE help teams think like attackers to build more secure systems.

The ISM requires risk assessment for systems processing classified information. Threat modelling provides structured input to these assessments and informs security control selection.

Conduct threat modelling workshops with developers, architects, and security specialists. Update models as systems evolve and new threats emerge.

name: Security by Design
description:
Security by Design embeds security considerations throughout the development lifecycle rather than treating security as an afterthought. This approach aligns with the ISM's emphasis on secure system development.

Incorporate security requirements gathering, secure coding practices, security testing, and security review gates into delivery pipelines. The Protective Security Policy Framework (PSPF) mandates this approach for Commonwealth entities.

Train development teams on secure coding practices relevant to their technology stack. OWASP provides language-specific secure coding guidelines.

name: Data Classification Framework
description:
Data Classification Frameworks categorise information based on sensitivity and required protections. Queensland Government uses OFFICIAL, SENSITIVE, and PROTECTED classifications aligned with the PSPF.

Proper classification enables appropriate security controls, storage decisions, and sharing arrangements. Misclassification leads to either over-protection (inefficiency) or under-protection (risk exposure).

Implement technical controls that enforce classification-based policies. Train staff on classification responsibilities and provide clear guidance for common information types.

name: IRAP Assessment
description:
IRAP (Infosec Registered Assessors Program) Assessment provides independent security assessment of ICT systems against the ISM. IRAP assessments are required for systems processing Australian Government classified information.

Engage IRAP assessors early in system development to identify compliance gaps before go-live. Assessment scope and rigour depend on the classification level of information processed.

Maintain assessment documentation and track remediation of identified issues. Re-assessment is required for significant system changes.

name: Continuous Authority to Operate
description:
Continuous Authority to Operate (cATO) moves beyond point-in-time security assessments to ongoing compliance monitoring. This approach maintains security assurance while enabling agile delivery.

Implement automated compliance checking, continuous vulnerability scanning, and real-time security monitoring. Evidence collection automation reduces assessment burden while improving assurance.

We're piloting cATO approaches that maintain ISM compliance evidence continuously. This enables faster deployments while satisfying governance requirements.

name: Secure Software Supply Chain
description:
Secure Software Supply Chain practices protect against compromised dependencies and build processes. Supply chain attacks like SolarWinds highlight the critical importance of this area.

Implement Software Bill of Materials (SBOM), dependency scanning, signed commits, and verified build pipelines. The Essential Eight's application control requirements extend to supply chain verification.

Evaluate dependencies against security criteria before adoption. Monitor for vulnerabilities in existing dependencies and establish rapid patching processes.

name: Digital Identity Verification
description:
Digital Identity Verification enables secure online proof of identity for government services. The Trusted Digital Identity Framework (TDIF) provides standards for identity proofing and authentication.

Integration with the Australian Government Digital Identity System enables citizens to access services using verified credentials. Queensland is implementing QDI (Queensland Digital Identity) aligned with TDIF.

Design services to support multiple identity assurance levels based on transaction risk. Not all services require the highest assurance level.

name: AI Governance Framework
description:
AI Governance Frameworks address the unique risks and ethical considerations of artificial intelligence in government. The Australian Government's AI Ethics Principles provide foundational guidance.

Government AI use requires transparency, accountability, and human oversight. Consider bias, explainability, and privacy implications. Some jurisdictions are developing specific AI procurement and use policies.

We're assessing governance frameworks for AI adoption in government contexts. Ensure alignment with emerging regulations and community expectations around government AI use.

name: Quantum-Safe Cryptography Planning
description:
Quantum-Safe Cryptography Planning prepares organisations for the cryptographic implications of quantum computing. Future quantum computers may break current public key cryptography.

The ASD Cryptographic Guidelines have begun addressing post-quantum considerations. Organisations should inventory cryptographic usage and monitor NIST post-quantum standard development.

Begin planning for cryptographic agility - the ability to transition to new algorithms when required. This is particularly important for systems with long data retention requirements.

name: GovCMS
description:
GovCMS is the Australian Government's whole-of-government content management platform built on Drupal. It provides a secure, compliant foundation for government websites and digital services.

GovCMS handles security patching, hosting, and compliance, allowing agencies to focus on content and user experience. The platform meets IRAP requirements and provides WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility compliance.

For new government websites, GovCMS should be the default choice unless specific requirements preclude its use. The platform reduces duplication of effort and security burden across government.

name: Microsoft 365 Government
description:
Microsoft 365 Government provides productivity and collaboration tools configured for Australian Government requirements. The PROTECTED-certified offering enables secure document collaboration and communication.

Queensland Government has established whole-of-government agreements for M365. The platform supports Essential Eight controls including application control and Microsoft Defender integration.

Implement appropriate Information Barriers, DLP policies, and sensitivity labels aligned with data classification requirements. Leverage Compliance Manager for ISM control mapping.

name: AWS GovCloud Australia
description:
AWS Australia (Sydney and Melbourne regions) provides IRAP-assessed cloud services suitable for Australian Government workloads up to PROTECTED classification.

AWS provides compliance documentation and control mappings for ISM and Essential Eight. The shared responsibility model requires agencies to implement customer-side controls appropriately.

Use AWS Control Tower and Security Hub for governance at scale. Implement landing zones that encode security and compliance requirements.

name: Azure Government Australia
description:
Microsoft Azure Australia regions provide IRAP-assessed cloud services with PROTECTED certification. Azure integrates well with Microsoft 365 Government for hybrid workloads.

Azure Policy and Blueprints enable enforcement of ISM-aligned configurations. The Australia Central regions provide additional data sovereignty assurance for sensitive workloads.

Leverage Azure's regulatory compliance dashboard for continuous ISM compliance monitoring. Implement Defender for Cloud for security posture management.

name: SAP S/4HANA Government
description:
SAP S/4HANA is used across Australian Government for finance, HR, and procurement functions. Queensland Government's QGEA includes SAP as a strategic platform for corporate systems.

Cloud migration paths for SAP require careful consideration of data sovereignty, integration patterns, and compliance requirements. RISE with SAP offerings are being evaluated for government use.

Plan SAP modernisation with clear understanding of data classification, integration requirements, and exit strategies. Consider ISM implications of cloud-hosted SAP environments.

name: ServiceNow Government
description:
ServiceNow provides IT Service Management and workflow automation capabilities. Government-specific offerings address compliance and security requirements for public sector use.

ServiceNow's GRC module can support ISM compliance tracking and risk management. Integration with security tools enables automated incident response workflows.

We're expanding ServiceNow use for ITSM and security operations. Evaluate data residency options and ensure appropriate access controls for sensitive workflow data.

name: Salesforce Government Cloud
description:
Salesforce Government Cloud provides CRM and citizen engagement capabilities configured for government requirements. The platform supports case management, licensing, and citizen service delivery.

Australian Government deployments require careful consideration of data residency - Salesforce's Australian data centres address sovereignty requirements for appropriate classifications.

Implement appropriate sharing rules, field-level security, and audit logging aligned with privacy and security requirements.

name: OpenShift Container Platform
description:
Red Hat OpenShift provides enterprise Kubernetes for containerised workloads. The platform's security features including built-in admission control and security context constraints support government security requirements.

OpenShift's operator model simplifies deployment of compliant configurations. The platform is available on major cloud providers and on-premises for sensitive workloads.

We're evaluating OpenShift for containerised government workloads. The platform's security posture and Red Hat's government experience make it suitable for assessment.

name: Legacy Mainframe Systems
description:
Legacy Mainframe Systems continue to run critical government functions but present modernisation challenges. Skills scarcity, integration complexity, and technical debt accumulate over time.

While mainframes remain reliable, new development should target modern platforms. Plan incremental modernisation through strangler patterns and API facades rather than risky big-bang replacements.

Maintain mainframe security patching and access controls. Document institutional knowledge before retirement of skilled staff.

name: .NET Core / .NET 6+
description:
NET 6+ is the modern, cross-platform evolution of the .NET framework. It provides strong security features, good performance, and alignment with Microsoft's government ecosystem.

For organisations with Microsoft investments, .NET provides natural integration with Azure Government and Microsoft 365. The framework supports Essential Eight application control through code signing.

Migrate legacy .NET Framework applications to .NET 6+ for continued support and security updates. New development should target the latest LTS release.

name: Java (LTS versions)
description:
Java LTS versions (17, 21) provide stable, secure foundations for enterprise government applications. Java's maturity, security track record, and ecosystem make it suitable for critical systems.

Government Java deployments should use vendor-supported distributions (Red Hat, Azul, Oracle) that provide security patches and support agreements.

Maintain currency with LTS versions and establish rapid patching processes for security vulnerabilities. The Essential Eight patching requirements apply to Java runtimes.

name: Python for Data and Automation
description:
Python is widely used in government for data analysis, automation, and machine learning. Its accessibility makes it valuable for analysts and data scientists across agencies.

For production systems, implement proper dependency management, security scanning, and code review processes. Python's flexibility requires disciplined practices to maintain security.

Use virtual environments and lock dependency versions. Scan dependencies against vulnerability databases and update promptly when issues are identified.

name: React with TypeScript
description:
React with TypeScript provides a robust foundation for government web applications. TypeScript's type safety reduces errors and improves maintainability of citizen-facing services.

Combine with the Australian Government Design System for consistent, accessible user experiences. The Design System provides React components that meet WCAG 2.1 AA requirements.

Implement Content Security Policy headers and ensure proper handling of user input to prevent XSS vulnerabilities in React applications.

name: Australian Government Design System
description:
Australian Government Design System (AGDS) provides accessible, consistent UI components for government digital services. Compliance with AGDS helps meet Digital Service Standard requirements.

The Design System ensures WCAG 2.1 AA compliance and provides a familiar experience for citizens across government services. Queensland has adopted AGDS as the standard for citizen-facing applications.

Use AGDS components rather than building custom UI elements. Contribute improvements back to the Design System community.

name: Terraform for Infrastructure
description:
Terraform enables Infrastructure as Code for government cloud environments. Codified infrastructure supports audit requirements and ensures consistent, repeatable deployments.

Develop Terraform modules that encode ISM-compliant configurations for common patterns. State file management requires appropriate security controls - consider Terraform Cloud or secure backend configurations.

Implement policy-as-code using Sentinel or Open Policy Agent to prevent deployment of non-compliant infrastructure.

name: Power Platform
description:
Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI) enables citizen development and workflow automation within the Microsoft 365 Government environment.

Power Platform can accelerate delivery of internal applications but requires governance to manage security and data risks. Implement DLP policies and environment controls.

Establish Centre of Excellence practices for Power Platform. Balance enablement with appropriate guardrails for data handling and integration.

name: Rust for Secure Systems
description:
Rust provides memory safety guarantees that eliminate entire classes of security vulnerabilities. For security-critical components, Rust's safety properties align with ISM secure coding requirements.

Government agencies including the US NSA recommend memory-safe languages for new development. Rust's adoption in security-sensitive contexts is growing.

We're assessing Rust for security-critical components where memory safety is paramount. Consider the learning curve and ecosystem maturity for your context.

name: Microsoft Defender Suite
description:
Microsoft Defender suite provides endpoint protection, threat detection, and response capabilities integrated with Microsoft 365 Government. The suite addresses multiple Essential Eight strategies.

Defender for Endpoint provides application control, attack surface reduction, and endpoint detection and response (EDR). Integration with Sentinel enables centralised security operations.

Configure Defender policies aligned with Essential Eight requirements. Implement automated response playbooks for common threat scenarios.

name: Microsoft Sentinel
description:
Microsoft Sentinel provides cloud-native SIEM and SOAR capabilities. Integration with Microsoft 365 and Azure simplifies log collection and enables advanced threat detection.

Sentinel's fusion detection and UEBA capabilities identify sophisticated attacks across data sources. Built-in connectors simplify integration with government technology stacks.

Develop Sentinel workbooks for ISM compliance monitoring. Implement automated response playbooks aligned with incident response procedures.

name: Qualys / Tenable for Vulnerability Management
description:
Qualys and Tenable provide vulnerability scanning capabilities essential for Essential Eight compliance. Regular vulnerability assessment identifies missing patches and misconfigurations.

Essential Eight Maturity Level 2 requires vulnerability scanning at least fortnightly. Integrate scanning into deployment pipelines for continuous assessment.

Configure scan policies aligned with ISM control requirements. Establish remediation SLAs based on vulnerability severity and exploitation likelihood.

name: CyberArk / Delinea for PAM
description:
Privileged Access Management (PAM) tools like CyberArk and Delinea address Essential Eight requirements for restricting administrative privileges and multi-factor authentication.

PAM solutions provide credential vaulting, session recording, and just-in-time access for privileged accounts. These capabilities are essential for ISM compliance at higher maturity levels.

Implement PAM for all administrative access to government systems. Integrate with identity providers and SIEM for comprehensive access governance.

name: HashiCorp Vault
description:
HashiCorp Vault provides secrets management and encryption services. For cloud-native government applications, Vault centralises credential management and provides audit trails.

Vault supports dynamic secrets, reducing the risk of credential exposure. Integration with Terraform enables secure infrastructure provisioning workflows.

Consider Vault for applications requiring programmatic secret access. Evaluate against cloud-native alternatives (AWS Secrets Manager, Azure Key Vault) based on your platform strategy.

name: GitHub Enterprise / GitLab
description:
GitHub Enterprise and GitLab provide source control and DevSecOps capabilities. Both platforms offer government-specific offerings addressing compliance requirements.

Implement branch protection, code review requirements, and security scanning in CI/CD pipelines. The platforms support Essential Eight application control through signed commits and protected deployments.

Configure repository security settings aligned with ISM requirements for software development. Enable Dependabot or equivalent for dependency vulnerability monitoring.

name: STIG Compliance Tools
description:
Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs) provide detailed hardening guidance. Tools like OpenSCAP and SCAP Compliance Checker automate STIG assessment.

While STIGs originate from US DoD, they provide valuable hardening baselines that align with ISM requirements. Many configurations map directly to ISM controls.

We're evaluating STIG automation tools for baseline compliance verification. Adapt STIG requirements to Australian Government context and ISM control mapping.

name: Splunk Enterprise Security
description:
Splunk Enterprise Security provides SIEM capabilities with strong analytics and investigation features. The platform has established presence in Australian Government security operations centres.

Splunk's search capabilities and app ecosystem support diverse log analysis use cases. Consider deployment options including Splunk Cloud for reduced operational overhead.

Evaluate Splunk against Microsoft Sentinel based on existing investments, log sources, and operational requirements. Both platforms can meet government security monitoring needs.

name: ACSC Cyber Security Tools
description:
ACSC Cyber Security Tools including the Essential Eight Assessment Tool and various hardening guides provide authoritative guidance for Australian Government cyber security.

The Essential Eight Maturity Model Assessment Tool enables self-assessment against maturity levels. ACSC publications provide implementation guidance aligned with ISM controls.

Regularly review ACSC advisories and implement recommended mitigations. Subscribe to ACSC alerts for threat intelligence relevant to government systems.
